text: Also known as ballista or bolt throwers, they are a missile weapon that launches large arrow-like projectiles at distant targets.
The Grand Bombard is made for one purpose only, the utter destruction of enemy defences.
A raging Fire Efreet is held captive in this monstrous cannon, which was made in a bygone age. It is said to drive its crew mad, and is therefore rarely used.
An effective siege engine capable of lobbing large wall- or creature-crushing boulders.
The finest knights of Araby, armed with an ornate arsenal they ride the finest steeds descended from Elven stock apparently.
A famous mercenary band that hails from the arid deserts of great Araby.

One major advantage the camel provides for these mounted archers is simply a better angle for their arrows to aim true than from their horse counterparts. Albeit, mounted archery on a camel is no easy task!
It's said these spear-armed cavalrymen were born in the saddle, making them a useful harassing force against infantry and cavalry alike.
The largest and fiercest scorpions in all the world, they require a rider who wears magical robes of protection that can cut through the sand.
Very heavily armoured and equipped with fine armaments, they are somewhat outdated and slow but are still formidable troops.
Armoured like turtles, brave as lions, with swords like wasp stings…
These nomadic horse archers can pepper an enemy before moving in for close-combat.
The Emirs are warriors without equal, who are promoted for their worth, serving as bodyguards for most important leaders of Araby.
These fearsome beasts can trample men and horse alike into the dust.
Returning to her native people after being ousted from the Border Princes, Princess Fatandira is equal parts a military commander and an enlightened ruler.
The sorcerers of Araby have perfected the art of binding aerial spirits into physical forms - not least of which is the famous Flying Carpets.
The Naffatun of Saghash are renowned for their chemical insight. Whether shot on the tips of arrows, or thrown in clay pots, there is no escaping the wet fire.
The self-styled "Sultan of the Seas", the eccentric Golden Magus hides incredible sorcerous powers beneath his gaudy appearance.
Lords of the Dune, many foes fall to furtive arrows before the rangers melt back into the sand.
Arabyans place great faith in the bow, and every Arabyan city maintains strong bodies of archers.
Guards are well-equipped with steel armour, keen tulwars and fine silk clothing. The loyalty of these troops is famous and they are amply rewarded with riches, luxuries, and prestige as a result.
The brutish ogres are a powerful ally to have on the battlefield, that is until they flee at the first sign of trouble.
These humble infantrymen form the solid foundation of any Arabyan army.
All is not what it seems...
These soldiers are often individuals brought up and trained as warriors or guards.
The scourge of the Great Ocean, who plunder the shores of Tilea and Estalia with wanton abandon.
Dervishers are fanatical, religious warriors all too willing to die for their Djinn gods.
They follow the teachings of the talented and fanatical Wizard Mullah Aklan'd, honouring his name and hope to die gloriously so they can pass into the highest of the seven heavens, St’oec.
Armed with long-barrelled arquebus of Arabyan design, the endless deserts have taught these men the value of marksmanship and an accurate firearm.

The Malaluk nomads inhabiting the lands around cursed Bel-Aliad are highly territorial and aggressive, famous for their sharpshooting and their strange maces known as "Pineapple Maces" or "Malaluk Sticks".
Pit-Fighters were usually slaves, criminals or prisoners of war but freemen also enlisted in search of gold and glory. Superbly-trained heavy infantry with little fear of death.

Slaves are forced to fight for their masters with only the poorest of equipment and training. Only the fear of punishment most cruel and the tiniest hope of being rewarded with their freedom one day keep them fighting.
Hailing from the fetid jungles of the far south, these warriors are well acquainted with all manner of beast and monster.

Some Arabyans are so adept at camel riding that they kick their training up a notch and carry jezzails into battle. Now, that's a sight to remember - if you're not on the other side of their dreadful aim.
Trained from birth to ride these sturdy beasts, most camel riders can be traced to Bedouin origin. They know how to tame it, and best of all, they know how to bond with it.
The desert Sorcerers of Araby follow their own ancient tradition, calling upon the Desert Spirits and their elemental might.
Some Arabyan Sorcerers have learned to bind Fire Efreets to their will, mastering the Wind of Aqshy in the process.
Tempest Djinns and the Wind of Azyr are powerful allies to these Arabyan Sorcerers.
The Sorcerers of Araby who dwell near the coasts are adept at manipulating the Wind of Ghyran and taming Sea Nymphs.
Sand Djinn that live in the deserts of Araby are a force to be reckoned with.
Inhabiting the western desert, Khar-mel knows many secrets forgotten by mortal man and many sorcerers and priests have tried to summon it to answer their questions.
Fire Efreets thrive under the hot sun of Araby and are powerful allies... and enemies.
Roaring like a wild cataclysm, the Sultan of Flames rises with a fire hotter than the sun itself, being the most terrible and titanic Efreet that inhabits the world.
The Genies of Araby have mastery over the four native elements: water, sand, fire, and air.
Overshadowed by their abominable undead cousins, they strike equal fear into their foes who meet claw and pincer.
These enormous birds inhabit the Atalan Mountains of Araby and are capable of lifting and carrying off a horse with its rider.
Reared from hatchlings, these dangerous creatures would be impossible to control without the aid of magic.
Water Djinn that dwell along the coasts of Araby are fearsome indeed.
The legendary Sea-Monarch is the most powerful of the Sea Nymphs, a power that makes any sailor and pirate tremble, as it is a true living tidal wave.
Air Djinn are native to the skies of Araby and are an excellent choice when it comes to enchanting furniture.
The fearsome Raging Tempest is considered a god of the winds, a being whose power can cause hurricanes so terrible that any empire will tremble at its strength.
Primitive and mysterious inhabitants of the savannas and jungles south of Araby, the one-eyed Waghzen have a special bond with their river horses or "hippopotami".
A unique gigantic specimen of elephant, the Ravager was tamed by the Sultan of El-Kalabad. Being fortification experts, the El-Kalabids set to build a small castle on top of the beast.
These fearsome beasts have a small mounted cannon, a concept originating in the faraway lands of Ind.
The cities of Araby conceal countless dangers in their shadows. Its assassins are famed for striking swiftly and unseen.

The Sheikhs are wise and powerful warriors, they bring great honour to Araby and are rightly rewarded though some struggle with the excess this life brings.
Undoubtedly the cruellest ruler ever in Araby, Jaffar controlled the land for many years during the Crusades. Thanks to a daemonic pact, he has returned to rule again.
In Araby, magic users are respected and invaluable councillors to Caliphs and Sultans, so naturally most end up in the illustrious position of Grand Vizier.
These fearsome beasts can trample men and horse alike into the dust.
Those Arabyan sorcerers are at it again, first it was carpets, and now ropes, when will this madness end?
Ingenious warmachines designed by the Natural Philosophers of Araby, they spew a substance known as Naphtha, burning enemies to a crisp.
Shihab Ibn Alim's mad experiments with Djinns and war engines have resulted in the Animunculus, a Naphtha Thrower driven forward by the will of a bound Fire Efreet alone.
The Dread Daughters are an all-female order of warrior-mages, bent on purging the Undead from Araby.
From atop this wondrous carriage, a Priest of the Djinns calls upon the elemental spirits to aid the armies of Araby.
The Black Scimitar Guard were an elite unit during the Crusades, sworn to serve Sultan Jaffar unto death. With Jaffar’s return he has re-formed them from the most skilful warriors at his command.
Deadly and sumptuous, the Scorpion could only be designed by Arabyan genius.
By trapping and coaxing a Tempest Djinn, one can achieve many wonders. Guided projectiles for instance.
Time to hit the books
Leave my land now, or stay forever in your graves.
These cultists of the Sultan of Flame are seeking to purify the world with fire.
The dread leader of the Black Scimitar Guard returns, bound by oath and death alike.
